0.title: No one can say a virus will become pandemic, no need to panic: Doctor on monkeypox cases
0.article_body: Amid detection of monkeypox cases in some foreign countries, a health expert insisted on observing its evolution while also advising not to panic. "No one can say for a fact that a virus will become a pandemic," said Dr Ishwar Gilada. "Monkeypox is zoonotic like HIV that initially came as monkey virus called simian immunodeficiency virus," he added.

1.title: 113 flyers made to wait at B'luru airport as gate key goes missing
1.article_body: About 113 passengers arriving at Bengaluru airport were reportedly made to wait for over 20 minutes at an arrival gate leading to the terminal after a security personnel was unable to unlock the gate, a report said. Meanwhile, journalist Vir Sanghvi, who tweeted about the incident, claimed the delay was caused because the key of the arrival gate went missing.

2.title: RCB change profile picture on social media in support of MI
2.article_body: RCB on Saturday changed their profile picture on their social media channels in support of MI ahead of their match against DC. RCB need MI to win to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs. "#RedTurnsBlue for today! We're backing you to #PlayBold all the way. Go get 'em, champs!" RCB tweeted. RCB will be knocked out if DC beat MI.

3.title: Air India bans smoking, consumption of intoxicating substances at workplace
3.article_body: Tata Group-run Air India has banned smoking and consumption of intoxicating substances at the workplace. In a letter to staff, Air India's CHRO Suresh Dutt Tripathi wrote that Air India is a responsible organisation which aims to provide a safe and healthy work environment. "We have zero-tolerance for violations...Any violation...will be dealt with appropriate consequences," Tripathi further said.

4.title: DU professor Ratan Lal who was arrested for post on Gyanvapi Mosque, gets bail
4.article_body: A Delhi court has granted bail to Delhi University professor Ratan Lal who was arrested on Friday over a social media post on the alleged discovery of Shivling inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. "The feeling of hurt felt by an individual cannot represent an entire group or community," said the court. Lal got bail on furnishing of ₹50,000 bond and surety.

5.title: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has ended Bollywood's dry spell: Kangana
5.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Saturday took to Instagram Stories to write, "Congratulations to 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' for ending the dry spell at Hindi box office. Congratulations to [the] entire team of the film." Trade analyst Taran Adarsh has stated that the film is actor Kartik Aaryan's biggest opener at the box office with a business of ₹14.11 crore in India.

6.title: Magazine once asked me to have 'affair' they could 'expose': Himanshu
6.article_body: Actor Himanshu Malik, known for his role in 2001 film 'Tum Bin', has revealed that he once got a call from a magazine publication asking him to have "an affair with an upcoming actress". Himanshu added that they even offered to book a hotel room in Goa. "I was told, 'You just go there and we will expose'," he said.

7.title: Any meeting with Kim Jong-un would depend on sincerity, says Biden
7.article_body: Speaking on a potential meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, US President Joe Biden has said, "It would depend on whether he was sincere and whether he was serious." Biden made the comment during his visit to South Korea. Notably, Biden's predecessor Donald Trump had met Kim three times, before diplomatic talks between the two countries ended in 2019.

8.title: Cricketer Deepak Chahar's sister Malti to make debut with 'Ishq Pashmina'
8.article_body: Cricketer Deepak Chahar's sister Malti Chahar is set to make her Bollywood debut with 'Ishq Pashmina'. Malti will be seen opposite influencer and actor Bhavin Bhanushali. "My character in this film is very unique and I hope the audience shower the film with...love," Malti said. Directed by Arvind Pandey, 'Ishq Pashmina' also stars Zarina Wahab and Brijendra Kala.

9.title: 6 bodies recovered from tunnel collapse site in J&K, 4 still missing
9.article_body: Six bodies have been recovered so far from the debris of an under-construction tunnel that collapsed on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway in the Ramban district on Thursday. Ramban Deputy Commissioner Mussarat Islam has said that three bodies have been identified and all were from West Bengal. The operation to locate at least four others is continuing.

10.title: Regret not taking care of myself: Arjun on his physical transformation
10.article_body: Arjun Kapoor, while talking about his recent physical transformation, said his extra work took a toll on him "mentally, emotionally and physically" and he regrets not taking care of himself. "I had implemented a very good lifestyle when I...started as an actor, somewhere that went away," he said, adding that it was COVID that gave him a reality check.

11.title: My coldest shoot ever: Parineeti on shooting at minus 12 degrees
11.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra is currently shooting for her upcoming project with singer-actor Harrdy Sandhu at a high altitude location. The actress took to Instagram on Friday to share the struggles of shooting at minus 12 degrees. "My coldest shoot ever. The best part was my hero also had to wear a thin costume and feel cold," Parineeti captioned the video.

12.title: Bihar's most-wanted gangster Azad Ali arrested in Delhi
12.article_body: Bihar's most-wanted gangster Azad Ali was arrested in Delhi by a special cell of Delhi Police on Saturday. The 43-year-old accused was held near Ring Road at Rajghat with the help of a tip-off. Ali was wanted in a shootout case during the Bihar's Vidhan Parishad election and a single-shot pistol was recovered from him, police said.

13.title: Prithviraj Chauhan was a Gurjar king, not Rajput: Gurjar body
13.article_body: Akhil Bharatiya Veer Gurjar Mahasabha has claimed that Prithviraj Chauhan was a Gurjar ruler and not a Rajput ruler. The body has also demanded that the producers of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' portray him as a Gurjar ruler in the film. The body's state president Manish Bhargad has asserted that the producers assured them nothing against the community will be portrayed.

14.title: GMDA lays 22-km long pipelines to use wastewater for public parks
14.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority has laid out 22 km of lateral pipelines along roads in order to maximise the use of treated wastewater for watering Gurugram's green belts and parks. The GMDA has planned to install 100 km of lateral pipelines in 2022-23, an official said. The major spots include Huda City Centre, Bakhtawar Chowk and IFFCO Chowk.

15.title: Bad decision, there's a clear deflection: Sachin on Wade's dismissal vs RCB
15.article_body: Reacting to GT's Matthew Wade's dismissal against RCB following a review for LBW, Sachin Tendulkar said, "[It was] unfortunate. He received a bad decision." "There was a clear deflection," added Sachin. Wade was seen throwing his bat and helmet in the dressing room after his dismissal resulting in him being reprimanded for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct.

16.title: Don't think myself as favourite for this year's French Open: Nadal
16.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal has said that he doesn't think of himself as a "favourite" for the upcoming French Open tournament despite winning the competition for the most number of times in history. "Unfortunately...I didn't have the preparation that I would like, and unfortunately, that rib fracture stopped a little bit (of momentum)," the 35-year-old said.

17.title: Playing for next 3 yrs at least: Shikhar Dhawan
17.article_body: After not getting picked in the Indian squad for the last year's T20 World Cup, 36-year-old batter Shikhar Dhawan has said that he is going to continue playing for "next three years at least". "I can contribute in the shortest format because of my experience...I have managed to stay consistent in the formats that I am playing," Dhawan said.

18.title: 12-year-old rape survivor gives birth in Tamil Nadu; neighbour arrested
18.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating his 12-year-old neighbour in Tamil Nadu's Tirupathur. The girl was admitted to hospital for stomach ache last month, where doctors found she was pregnant. On being questioned, she told her mother that the accused raped her repeatedly when she was alone at home. She delivered a baby on May 3.

19.title: Telecom regulator planning KYC-based caller's identification system
19.article_body: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is planning to develop a KYC-based system that can help people identify a caller’s identity on a mobile phone, as per an official. Referring to it, Truecaller said, "Number identification is crucial to ending the menace of spam...calls...We appreciate this move...and would like to reiterate that we remain very supportive of this."

20.title: Rahul calls Indian Foreign Service 'arrogant', 'it's confidence', says Jaishankar
20.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has responded to Rahul Gandhi's remarks calling Indian Foreign Service officers "arrogant". "Yes, the Indian Foreign Service has changed. Yes, they follow the orders of the Government. Yes, they counter the arguments of others. No, it's not called Arrogance. It is called Confidence," said Jaishankar. Rahul made the remarks at Cambridge University in London.

21.title: Kolkata man hired women to honey trap & blackmail men; arrested
21.article_body: Kolkata Police arrested a man from Hare Street for allegedly setting up honey traps for men and blackmailing them for money. According to police, the accused would hire women who engaged in conversations with various men. They recorded video calls with them while posing nude. The accused used these videos to blackmail men and demanded money from them, police said.

22.title: Pune civic body seals 221 kiosks over non-payment of license fee
22.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has sealed 221 kiosks in Tulsibaug over non-payment of license fees. The PMC has said that it's owed ₹3 crore by kiosk owners as per the revised rates approved by the general body in 2018. "We had been sending notices since 2018 demanding dues to be paid but to no avail," a senior official said.

23.title: India's AstroSat witnesses black hole birth for 500th time in space
23.article_body: AstroSat, India's dedicated astronomy mission, has detected the birth of a black hole for the 500th time, Pune-based research institution IUCAA has said. It added that India is making great headway in studying the birth of these black holes. A black hole is a place in space where gravity is so strong that even light cannot escape its pull.

24.title: Was taken aback by her preparation: Akshay on 'Prithviraj' co-star Manushi
24.article_body: Akshay Kumar, while talking about his 'Prithviraj' co-star Manushi Chhillar, said he was taken aback by the actress' preparation for her role. Akshay added, "She knew she had a responsibility towards the character and she has essayed Sanyogita beautifully." "She learnt in her first film what I learnt...by my 25th film," he said while calling Manushi a natural actor.

25.title: Umpire guards MS Dhoni as fan invades ground to meet him, video goes viral
25.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a fan invading the ground to meet CSK captain MS Dhoni during CSK's match against RR on Friday. In the video, the umpire can be seen guarding MS Dhoni from a distance as the fan tried to approach the cricketer. The incident happened when Dhoni was standing near the non-striker's end while batting.

26.title: 4, including ex-BJP MP's nephew, killed in road accident in Chhattisgarh
26.article_body: At least four persons were killed after a truck rammed into a mini goods vehicle in which they were travelling on Friday in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur, police said. One of the deceased was the nephew of former BJP MP from Bilaspur, Lakhan Lal Sahu, police added. Three of the victims died on the spot, another died in a hospital, police stated.

27.title: US, other APEC delegates walk out on Russian speaker
27.article_body: Representatives from the US and four other countries on Saturday staged a walkout when a Russian representative began his opening remarks at a meeting of trade ministers of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation group in Bangkok, officials said. The walkout was "an expression of disapproval at Russia's illegal war...in Ukraine and its economic impact in the APEC region", a diplomat said.

28.title: Feel like a racehorse scratching its stall and wanting to race: Federer
28.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said he feels like a racehorse scratching its stall and wanting to race. "I'm ready to give it my all again," added Federer. "I am looking forward to coming home in the evening after the tough day of training and being completely exhausted," he stated. Federer has been out of action since July 2021.

29.title: Ford's internet-linked cars face nationwide sales ban in Germany
29.article_body: A German court has put a nationwide sales and production ban on Ford cars that are able to establish an internet connection, in a case over violation of wireless technology patents. The verdict is not legally binding and can still be appealed. The plaintiff, Japan's IP Bridge, needs to make a $240-million security payment for it to become "provisionally enforceable".

30.title: Doctors are being made scapegoats: ISOT on Ruby Hall Clinic case
30.article_body: The Indian Society of Nephrology (ISN) and the Indian Society of Organ Transplantation (ISOT) have condemned the handling of the case related to alleged malpractices in a kidney transplant procedure at Pune's Ruby Hall Clinic. "Doctors are being made scapegoats," Sunil Shroff, ISOT's President said. Police have booked 15 people, including some doctors of Ruby Hall Clinic, in the case.

31.title: 65-year-old man killed by tiger in Maharashtra's Chandrapur
31.article_body: A 65-year-old man was killed by a tiger in a forest area near Chandrapur, Maharashtra. The incident happened after the deceased, identified as Dashrath Pendor, had gone into the forests to graze goats on Friday, an official said. A big cat, identified as Waghadoh, is roaming in the area and the forest department is yet to catch it, official said.

32.title: Hoping to bag 4 titles by season end: Liverpool's Mo Salah
32.article_body: After already bagging the FA Cup and League Cup, Liverpool's Mohamed Salah is hoping that the club can make a quadruple by winning this year's Champions League final and the Premier League title. "I wish Manchester City lose or draw, and we win the Premier League," Salah said. "I am very excited about the (Champions League) final," he added.

33.title: Moselle Open 2010 win much better than beating Nadal or Federer: Simon
33.article_body: Former world number six Gilles Simon said winning the Moselle Open in 2010 was "much better" than defeating Rafael Nadal or Roger Federer, having beaten them in 2008. "We are talking about tennis performance," added Simon. Discussing his decision to retire from tennis at the end of the 2022 season, he stated that everything seems too difficult.

34.title: K'taka minister invites UK university to set up campus in B'luru
34.article_body: Karnataka Higher Education Minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan on Friday invited officials from the UK's Edinburgh University to open its campus in Bengaluru, the minister's office said in a statement. He had done so during his visit to the over 400-year-old university. "Edinburgh University is renowned for multi-disciplinary education which is also the core of the National Education Policy," he said.

35.title: Will follow court's order: Rajasthan Min on rape case against son
35.article_body: Speaking on accusation against son for raping 23-year-old woman, Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi said that the case is sub judice and they will follow court's orders. "Police are doing their job and so is the law. Law is same for everyone," he said. On May 8, Delhi Police filed a rape case against his son, Rohit, on the woman's complaint.

36.title: Offered COVID-19 vaccines to North Korea, got no response: US
36.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Saturday said America had offered North Korea and China COVID-19 vaccines but "got no response". North Korea, which reported its first outbreak of COVID-19 earlier this month, has recorded nearly 25 lakh "fever" cases and 66 deaths despite a "maximum emergency" epidemic campaign. North Korea is yet to start a mass vaccination campaign against COVID-19.

37.title: Cryptos are worth nothing, based on nothing: European Central Bank chief
37.article_body: European Central Bank's President Christine Lagarde said, "My very humble assessment is that it (cryptocurrency) is worth nothing, it is based on nothing, there is no underlying asset to act as an anchor of safety." Stating that she's concerned about people who have no understanding of the risks related to cryptocurrencies, Lagarde said that cryptocurrencies should be regulated.

38.title: Mentally ill man slapped, asked 'Is your name Mohammed?'; later found dead in MP
38.article_body: A missing mentally ill man named Bhanwarlal Jain was found dead in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch and a video showing a man asking him if his "name is Mohammed", and repeatedly slapping him has surfaced on social media. The attacker in the video has been identified as Dinesh Kushwaha, who is reportedly the husband of a former BJP corporator.

39.title: Investor's defamation case against Musk, his fan & Tesla dismissed
39.article_body: A defamation and securities fraud lawsuit against Tesla, CEO Elon Musk and a Musk fan, brought forward by a Tesla investor Aaron Greenspan, has been dismissed. A US judge found that the lawsuit had failed to make plausible legal claims. The lawsuit alleged that Omar Qazi, a Musk fan, defamed Greenspan in his tweets that made baseless accusations against him.

40.title: Female dancer, others shoot dance video at Pune's Lal Mahal; booked
40.article_body: Female Marathi dancer Vaishnavi Patil and a few others have been booked for shooting a Lavani dance video at Pune's Lal Mahal, where Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj spent several years of his childhood, an official said on Saturday. According to officials, the accused hadn't taken permission for shooting the video. Meanwhile, Patil issued an apology after political leaders condemned the video.

41.title: I like investing in things with valuable output: Gates on why he doesn't own crypto
41.article_body: Microsoft's Co-founder Bill Gates in an interaction revealed why he doesn't own any cryptocurrencies. He said, "I like investing in things that have valuable output. The value of companies is based on how they make great products. The value of cryptocurrency is just what some other person decides someone else will pay...so not adding to society like other investments."

42.title: Existence of over 500 lost animal species remains uncertain: Study
42.article_body: After reviewing 32,802 species from the IUCN Red List, researchers have identified 562 lost species. These species haven't been seen by anyone in over 50 years but they are not yet considered extinct, the study stated. Such species with an uncertain conservation status may create problems in future as the extinction crisis worsens and more species go missing, researchers said.

43.title: Paytm posts ₹762.5 cr loss in Q4, says 'on track to break-even by Sept 2023'
43.article_body: Paytm has reported a loss of ₹762.5 crore for the March quarter of the financial year 2021-22, up 72% from ₹444.4 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal. The company's revenue from operations were up by 89% year-on-year at ₹1,541 crore for the quarter. Paytm said it is "on track to achieve break-even by quarter ending September 2023".

44.title: Over 2,000 fire-related incidents reported in Delhi so far in May
44.article_body: Delhi Fire Services on Friday said that over 2,000 (2,145) fire-related incidents were reported in the national capital in the first 19 days of May this year. Furthermore, it said that 42 people were killed and 117 were injured in such incidents. The Mundka blaze that killed about 27 people was among the major fire incidents in May, officials said.

45.title: Account hacked: Adhir Ranjan as Rajiv Gandhi quote on Sikh riots tweeted by his handle
45.article_body: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has filed a police complaint claiming his Twitter account was hacked, after a 1984 quote by former PM Rajiv Gandhi was tweeted from his account. The now-deleted tweet had Rajiv Gandhi's "Whenever a big tree falls, the earth shakes" remark that he made after the deadly Sikh riots that followed Indira Gandhi's death.

46.title: Vijay Shekhar Sharma reappointed CEO and MD of Paytm for 5 years
46.article_body: Paytm on Saturday said that its board of Directors have approved the reappointment of Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma as Managing Director (MD) and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the company. Sharma's reappointment is effective for a tenure of 5 years till December 18, 2027. Further, Paytm's board has also approved the appointment of its CFO Madhur Deora as Whole-time Director.

47.title: Pune Police book 4 foreigners for stealing crypto tokens
47.article_body: Four foreigners, including three Vietnamese and a Bangladeshi, have been booked by Pune Police for stealing crypto tokens worth ₹24 lakh from a city-based company. The theft took place after one of the accused was hired by the company to develop a server node, the police said. The other accused had helped the main accused in the theft, they said.

48.title: DU students protest after professor held over post on 'Shivling'
48.article_body: The students of Delhi University on Friday staged a protest after police arrested the Hindu College Associate Professor, Ratan Lal, over an alleged derogatory social media post. The professor's post was reportedly in connection with the claims of a 'Shivling' found at Varanasi's Gyanvapi Mosque. Police have said that Lal had allegedly "intended to outrage reli­gious beliefs" in his post.

49.title: UK PM Boris Johnson's father becomes French citizen
49.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson's father, Stanley Johnson, has secured French citizenship. "This decision concerns...Stanley Johnson only and doesn't extend to his descendants," French Justice Ministry said. The development means that the 81-year-old, whose mother was French, will retain all the rights of EU citizenship that British citizens lost after Brexit. He doesn't have to give up his UK nationality.

50.title: How did MS Dhoni perform in IPL 2022 as compared to other seasons?
50.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni scored 232 runs in IPL 2022, the third-lowest amount of runs he scored in a season. He had a batting average of 33.14 as compared to 16.28 in IPL 2021. Dhoni, who had a strike rate of 116.27 and 106.54 in IPL 2020 and IPL 2021 respectively, recorded a strike rate of 123.40 in IPL 2022.

51.title: RCB's Dinesh Karthik shares old pic in MI jersey to show support for MI against DC
51.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik took to Twitter to share a picture of himself in MI jersey to show support for MI ahead of their match against DC. "Found this in archives," wrote Karthik followed by a 'fingers crossed' emoji. RCB will qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs if MI defeat DC, however, they will be eliminated if DC win.

52.title: Sushmita Sen celebrates 28 years of her Miss Universe win
52.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen on Saturday took to social media to celebrate 28 years of her winning the Miss Universe title. She wrote in the caption, "Beautiful is a feeling. Happy 28 years of INDIA winning Miss Universe for the very first time!! Time flies...Beauty remains!!!" A fan page of Sushmita also shared a video from the pageant on social media.

53.title: Shivling found in Gyanvapi mosque is one of 12 Jyotirlingas: VHP chief
53.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) chief Alok Kumar on Friday claimed that the Shivling reportedly found at Gyanvapi mosque is one of the 12 Jyotirlingas. "The location suggests that it's one of the...12 Jyotirlingas...Gyanvapi mosque complex has been built over the ruins of the desecrated old temple invaded by Mughals...We will be able to prove it to the court," Kumar claimed.

54.title: Upper-caste students at U'khand govt school refuse to eat food cooked by Dalit
54.article_body: A number of upper-caste students boycotted mid-day meals prepared by a Dalit cook in a government school in Uttarakhand's Champawat district. "Around 7-8 students have again refused to eat the food cooked by Sunita Devi," the principal said. The cook was sacked last year after 66 students refused to eat meals prepared by her. She was later reappointed.

55.title: What more do MI need for Rohit? Rohit fans, Kohli fans are all with him: Ravi Shastri
55.article_body: Ahead of MI-DC match, former India head coach Ravi Shastri said that he believes Rohit Sharma will come good in his team's last league match in IPL 2022. "What more do MI need for Rohit? Rohit fans, Virat Kohli fans, RCB fans are all with him," he added. Notably, RCB need MI to defeat DC to qualify for the playoffs.

56.title: Akshay too big for these small things: Anees on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
56.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee, speaking about not casting Akshay Kumar in the film, said that the actor is "too big for these small things". The director further said that he has brought back a few things from the first film like the haveli, Rajpal Yadav's character, Monjulika and the songs 'Aami Je Tomar' and 'Teri Aankhein Bhool Bhulaiyaa'.

57.title: Only diplomacy can end Ukraine war: Zelenskyy
57.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the war in Ukraine "will be bloody, there will be fighting but will only definitively end through diplomacy". Negotiations between Russia and Ukraine are at a standstill, with both nations accusing each other of intransigence. "We want everything to return [to as it was before]" but "Russia doesn't want that", Zelenskyy added without elaborating.

58.title: Musk says Dogecoin Co-creator Palmer is 'little negative at times'
58.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Dogecoin Co-creator Jackson Palmer can be a "little negative at times". He said this in response to Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus urging Twitter users to listen to Jackson talking about cryptocurrency's "silliness" in a podcast, even if they disagree with him. Responding to Musk, Markus jokingly said, "I don't disagree."

59.title: Woman awarded ₹72 lakh after not being invited for drinks by colleagues in UK
59.article_body: A 51-year-old casino cashier in the UK was awarded £74,113 (around ₹72 lakh) by an employment tribunal as compensation after she claimed she was 'shunned' by her colleagues. Rita Leher said her colleagues at Aspers Casino went out for drinks and she was the only one who wasn't invited. Her colleagues had also discussed the outing in front of her.

60.title: Just don't knock me out: Salman on Nikhat Zareen's boxing gold
60.article_body: After Nikhat Zareen won the gold medal at the Women's World Boxing Championships 2022, actor Salman Khan congratulated her on Twitter, writing, "Congratzz." In a separate tweet, Salman wrote, "Just don't knock me out...keep punching like my hero Sylvester Stallone." Nikhat was earlier asked if 'Salman Bhai' congratulated her, to which she said, "Whose brother? Your brother...He is my jaan."

61.title: Prez Kovind gives kits to aspiring cricketers in St Vincent and Grenadines
61.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind handed over eight cricket kits to aspiring cricketers in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. Recently, President Kovind gifted cricket kits to the Jamaica Cricket Association as well. President Kovind, who is on a four-day visit to the Caribbean nation, is the first Indian President ever to visit Saint Vincent and the Grenadines.

62.title: Russia says it destroyed large weapons consignment from US, Europe in Ukraine
62.article_body: Russia on Saturday said that it had destroyed a major consignment of Western arms in Ukraine's Zhytomyr region using sea-launched Kalibr cruise missiles. The strike took out "a large batch of weapons and military equipment delivered from the USA and European countries" and intended for Ukrainian troops, it further said.

63.title: People judge based on what they see, can be really hard for players: Ana
63.article_body: Ex-world number one tennis player Ana Ivanovic said people make judgements according to what they see which is not the full story in most cases, adding it can get "really hard" for players to get over it. "[It] upsets me," stated Ana. She said there is a lot more pressure on women to perform in tennis in comparison to men.

64.title: Karnataka gives 33% reservation to women in outsourced government jobs
64.article_body: Karnataka government has granted 33% reservation to women in outsourced government jobs. Chief Secretary P Ravi Kumar issued a circular in this regard on Friday. Out of 7.2 lakh sanctioned posts in Karnataka with around 4.6 lakh employees, there are around 1.5 lakh outsourced staff. Hence, around 50,000 posts will be reserved for women employees now.

65.title: 2 railway workers held over hoax bomb threat tweets about train in MP
65.article_body: Two railway contract workers were arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain over hoax bomb threat tweets about a train, the police said on Friday. The accused claimed that they had made the tweets to delay the train so as to spend more time with their families. The tweets were made on May 11 and May 18, according to the police.

66.title: 57 US lawmakers seek FBI probe into killing of Al Jazeera journalist
66.article_body: Fifty-seven US lawmakers have called on the FBI to investigate the killing of Al Jazeera reporter Shireen Abu Akleh. She was shot dead during an Israeli military raid in West Bank on May 11. "As an American...Abu Akleh was entitled to...full protections afforded to US citizens living abroad," lawmakers wrote to State Secretary Antony Blinken and FBI Director Christopher Wray.

67.title: Sri Lanka lifts state of emergency after 2 weeks as law & order situation improves
67.article_body: The Sri Lankan government on Saturday lifted the state of emergency, nearly two weeks after it was imposed amid anti-government protests over the nation's worst economic crisis. As per the authorities, the move was taken with the improvement of the law and order situation. President Gotabaya Rajapaksa had declared a state of emergency with effect from May 6 midnight.

68.title: Expectations don't pressurise me, but help me evolve as actor: Kiara
68.article_body: Kiara Advani, in an interview, said she doesn't feel pressured by expectations, rather they have helped her evolve as an actor. She added that she did not sign her first pan-India film out of any pressure, but because her fans wanted so. "When you see people think that you are worth it, it is a beautiful feeling," Kiara said.

69.title: Hyd's Skyroot test fires solid fuel engine of its rocket 'Vikram-1'
69.article_body: Hyderabad-based space startup Skyroot has successfully test fired a solid fuel-based engine that will be used as the third stage in its rocket, 'Vikram-1'. The rocket stage, dubbed 'Kalam 100', was fired in testing facilities for the full duration of 108 seconds. Vikram-1 is capable of putting 225-kilogram payloads into sun-synchronous polar orbit.

70.title: 2 Delhi residents held in Pune for posing as GST officers
70.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police held two men, residents of Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar area, for allegedly cheating people by posing as GST officers. The accused, identified as Manojkumar Chabinath and Omprakash Pande, were arrested after a complaint was filed against them by trader Shadan Khan at Pune's Chikhali police station. The duo had allegedly demanded money from Khan, police said.

71.title: Excise dept gives first 'home bar' licence in Ghaziabad district
71.article_body: The excise department issued a home bar licence to a Ghaziabad resident which is first such licence to be issued in the district. As per UP's excise policy, one needs to have licence to keep more than two bottles of liquor at home and on obtaining the licence one can keep maximum 84 (750ml) bottles of different types at home.

72.title: Nick Jonas gifts customised car to Priyanka Chopra, actress shares pic
72.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram to share a picture of the customised car gifted to her by husband Nick Jonas. She can be seen sitting in an all terrain vehicle (ATV) with the words 'Mrs Jonas' written on the side. Sharing the picture, Priyanka wrote, "Now that's a ride...Thank you @nickjonas...always helping me with my cool quotient."

73.title: I'm not a billionaire anymore: Ethereum's 28-yr-old Co-founder Buterin
73.article_body: Ethereum's 28-year-old Co-founder Vitalik Buterin on Friday tweeted that he is "not a billionaire anymore" after a massive sell-off in the cryptocurrency market recently. Buterin, who created Ethereum in 2014, became the world's youngest crypto billionaire last year. A digital wallet held by Buterin contained crypto holdings worth about $1.5 billion as recently as November, Bloomberg reported.

74.title: Don't see Cong as 'big daddy': Rahul after criticism on his regional parties remark
74.article_body: After Rahul Gandhi was criticised for his remarks saying regional parties 'lacked ideologies' to take on BJP, the Congress leader said his comments were misconstrued. "I don't view Congress as the big daddy," said Rahul at a Cambridge University event. "In no way is Congress superior to the other opposition parties. We're all fighting the same battle," he added.

75.title: Pete Davidson to exit Saturday Night Live after 8 seasons: Report
75.article_body: Comedian Pete Davidson will reportedly exit Saturday Night Live after eight seasons. Davidson is expected to quit the show during the season 47 finale this weekend, reports added. According to Variety, the comedian made his debut on Saturday Night Live in 2014 as one of the youngest cast members at the age of 20.

76.title: Got drunk after winning US Open 2005, felt nauseous for days: Federer
76.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said the last time he got drunk was in 2005 after defeating former world number one Andre Agassi in the final of the US Open. "We ordered a few...shots, after which I was nauseous for days. But actually I never lose control," added Federer. "I...like to drink champagne to celebrate special moments," he stated.

77.title: Waited inside aircraft for 3 hrs: Dia after Vistara flight gets diverted & cancelled
77.article_body: Dia Mirza took to Twitter after her Delhi bound flight was diverted and then cancelled. Complaining to Vistara about the lack of assistance regarding it, she tweeted that while they waited inside the aircraft for three hours before the flight was cancelled, "No one from the airport authority or Vistara" were there to offer any answers.

78.title: Jharkhand to paint govt schools green, white; BJP criticises move
78.article_body: After the Jharkhand Education Project Council issued an order for government schools across the state to be painted in green and white shades, the BJP alleged that the move was politically motivated as the colours are associated with the state's ruling party JMM. However, state Education Minister Jagarnath Mahto told PTI that the colours were chosen based on "experts' recommendations".

79.title: 65-yr-old differently-abled man beaten to death in Madhya Pradesh
79.article_body: A 65-year-old differently-abled man was allegedly beaten to death in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch on Friday. A video of the incident has reportedly gone viral on social media. "Bhanwarlal Jain was beaten...over suspicion of belonging to a particular religion. The accused person Dinesh Kushwaha, in...video, can be seen asking 'show me your identity card' while thrashing him," a police official said.

80.title: Bangladeshi national contested 2021 Assembly seat for TMC: Calcutta HC
80.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) candidate Alo Rani Sarkar, who contested the Bongaon South Assembly seat in 2021, is a Bangladeshi national by virtue of birth, the Calcutta High Court said on Friday. HC was hearing Sarkar's petition that challenged the poll results that were declared on May 2, 2021. BJP's Swapan Majumdar had defeated Sarkar by around 2,000 votes.

81.title: Targeted attempts trying to disable our internet resources: Putin
81.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said "targeted attempts" are being made to "disable...internet resources of Russia's critical...infrastructure". "Attempts to illegally penetrate...corporate networks of leading Russian companies are much more frequent as well," he added. Putin said Russia will need to improve information security in key sectors and switch to using domestic technology.

82.title: 2-day 'Chintan Shivir' to be held in Chandigarh by Haryana Cong
82.article_body: Congress' Haryana unit will be organising a two-day 'Chintan Shivir' in Chandigarh on May 31 and June 1. The meet will be held to implement the resolution in the state, passed in the recently concluded 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur. The decision to hold 'Chintan Shivir' was taken in a meeting chaired by Haryana Congress State President Udai Bhan on Friday.

83.title: Over 1.2 bn people face fatal health risks from extreme heat: Report
83.article_body: Over 1.2 billion people worldwide face fatal health risks due to extreme heat and a lack of cooling, report by Sustainable Energy for All stated. The numbers this year have increased by 28 million as compared to 2021. The report also called for investment in solutions like tree planting, affordable hyper-efficient air conditioners, well-designed buildings etc to tackle the crisis.

84.title: Revenue from beer increases in Pune as sales surge by 30 lakh litres
84.article_body: Beer sales in Pune increased by 30 lakh litres in the month of April and May because of which the revenue of the state increased by ₹213 crore, Maharashtra's excise department data showed. "Alcohol sales in Maharashtra have picked up again in 2021-22, especially during the COVID-19 period of 2020-21," Confederation of Indian Alcoholic Beverage Companies' President Deepak Roy said.

85.title: 75 mohalla clinics to be set up by August 15 in Punjab: CM Bhagwant Mann
85.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday announced that 75 mohalla clinics will be set up before India's 75th Independence Day on August 15. "Will fulfil the promise of providing excellent and free treatment to the people of Punjab," Mann tweeted. "The government...identified 130 defunct Sewa Kendras and Saanjh Kendras...will be converted into mohalla clinics," state Health Minister Vijay Singla said.

86.title: 16-year-old Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa defeats world no. 1 Carlsen for 2nd time in 2022
86.article_body: India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the fifth round of the Chessable Masters online rapid chess tournament on Friday. It is R Praggnanandhaa's second victory against Carlsen in 2022. He had earlier defeated Carlsen in the eighth round of the Airthings Masters in February.

87.title: Chahal has answered RCB by becoming IPL 2022's leading wicket-taker: Akhtar
87.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said Yuzvendra Chahal had a point to prove to his former franchise RCB, having been released ahead of the IPL mega auction. "[Releasing him] was like telling him, 'Listen, you aren't good enough'. Chahal has answered [RCB] by becoming...IPL 2022's leading wicket-taker [so far]," added Akhtar. Chahal has picked 26 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

88.title: Russia likely facing Uncrewed Aerial Vehicles shortage: UK
88.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said Russian forces in Ukraine are likely experiencing a shortage of appropriate reconnaissance Uncrewed Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), used to "identify targets to be struck by combat jets or artillery". "If Russia continues to lose UAVs at...current rate, Russian forces...reconnaissance capability will be further degraded, negatively impacting operational effectiveness," it added.

89.title: US university's students create edible tortilla tape to fix wrap problem
89.article_body: A team of chemical and biomolecular engineering students at the Johns Hopkins University has made an edible tortilla tape to fix wrap problem. The 'Tastee Tape' can be used to seal the wrap or burrito and avoid fillings from falling. The tape is clear, however, the team added blue dye in videos to better illustrate its use.

90.title: Loved Kohli's shot to reach his fifty vs GT, was just brilliant: Sachin
90.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar said Virat Kohli's shot to complete his half-century during his 73 off 54 balls against GT was just "brilliant", adding that he "loved" the shot. "At the last moment, he used his wrist to give it elevation," stated Sachin. "I really liked...the precision in his footwork and like they say showing the face of the bat," he said.

91.title: Delhi's peak power demand crosses 7,000 MW-mark, highest ever in May
91.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand rose to 7,070 MW (megawatts) on Thursday, the highest ever in May and this year's highest so far. Notably, the previous highest peak power demand for the month of May in Delhi was 6,780 MW on May 13, 2022. Delhi's peak power demand crossed the 7,000 MW-mark for the first time on July 10, 2018.

92.title: Diversity never caused any conflict in India: Rajnath Singh
92.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said India is the only country where people from different religions live in harmony and its diversity has never been the cause of any conflict. "Seventy-two sects of Muslim society are found in this country. India's oldest church dates back years ago," Singh said while addressing a religious gathering in Vadodara.

93.title: 33 die as strong winds, rains hit Bihar; CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
93.article_body: As many as 33 people have died in 16 districts of Bihar due to thunderstorms and lightning amid strong winds and heavy rains. CM Nitish Kumar announced ₹4 lakh ex-gratia each to the family of the deceased. "I'm deeply saddened to see that many people died in the incidents of thunderstorm and lightning in Bihar," PM Narendra Modi tweeted.

94.title: Dhanush sends legal notice to couple claiming him to be their biological son
94.article_body: Indian actor Dhanush and his father Kasthuri Raja have sent a court notice to a Madurai-based couple who claim that Dhanush is their biological son. In the notice, they have asked the couple to stop making "specious" claim regarding Dhanush. They have also requested the couple to publish a public statement admitting that all of their charges are baseless.

95.title: DC owner Parth Jindal trolled for his 'Never liked anyone doing any favours for us' tweet
95.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) owner Parth Jindal has been trolled for his tweet ahead of DC-MI match. "Never liked anyone doing any favours for us anyway...equation is simple...we win on Saturday and we get the opportunity of going further in IPL," he had written. Fans shared a video of DC players rooting for GT to defeat RCB by saying GT's slogan.

96.title: Which countries have reported cases of monkeypox so far?
96.article_body: More than 80 cases of monkeypox have been confirmed in at least 12 countries so far. Infections have been confirmed in nine European countries, as well as the US, Canada and Australia. Public health agencies in Europe have confirmed cases in UK, Spain, Portugal, Germany, Belgium, France, Netherlands, Italy and Sweden. There are now 20 confirmed cases in UK.

97.title: CBI officials misbehaved with Rabri Devi: RJD
97.article_body: After the CBI team raided Rabri Devi's residence in Patna for being accused in a corruption case, the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) alleged that CBI officials "misbehaved" with Rabri Devi and used "unparliamentary language" during their interrogation. "We reiterate that the latest CBI case and the raids conducted across the country...are sponsored by BJP," RJD's spokesperson said.

98.title: Villagers perform death ritual of Thane hospital to protest mismanagement
98.article_body: Residents of adjoining villages gathered outside the government-run Indira Gandhi Hospital in Thane's Bhiwandi area and performed the death ritual of the healthcare facility to protest its mismanagement on Friday. They brought a big portrait of the "dead" hospital, garlanded it and performed the mock death rituals to draw the management's attention towards lack of basic facilities at the hospital.

99.title: 7 die, 10 injured after vehicle rams into tree in Karnataka's Dharwad
99.article_body: At least seven persons died and 10 were injured after their vehicle rammed into a tree in Nigadi in Karnataka's Dharwad on Friday night, police said. The vehicle was carrying 21 people who were travelling to Benkankatti after attending a wedding, police stated. A case has been registered under section 304A of the IPC (causing death by negligence), police stated.

100.title: Maha govt concerned about bar operators rather than farmers: Fadnavis
100.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government was more concerned about bar operators and reducing the prices of foreign liquor than solving problems faced by farmers. The MVA government has not given a penny to those affected by storms and heavy rains, the former Maharashtra CM said at a farmers' rally in Solapur.

101.title: 40 people injured, houses damaged as tornado hits Germany
101.article_body: A tornado swept through parts of western Germany on Friday injuring around 40 people, "10 of them seriously", police said. The tornado damaged several homes, disrupted traffic and uprooted trees that toppled onto rail tracks and roads. The German Weather Service has warned that the stormy weather was set to continue. Police have asked locals to stay at home.

102.title: CBI raids brokers in Delhi, Mumbai & other cities in NSE co-location scam case
102.article_body: The CBI on Saturday carried out a coordinated search operation at over 10 locations in multiple cities in connection with the NSE co-location scam case. The searches will cover brokers at more than 12 premises in Mumbai, Delhi and Kolkata, among others. Notably, CBI has filed a chargesheet against former NSE CEO and MD Chitra Ramkrishna in the case.

103.title: I did not want to kill, I was nervous: Russian soldier who killed 62-year-old Ukrainian
103.article_body: A 21-year-old Russian soldier told a court that he "sincerely repented" killing an unarmed 62-year-old civilian in the northeast Ukrainian village of Chupakhivka on February 28. "I was nervous at the time, I did not want to kill...that's how it happened," Vadim Shishimarin said. Shishimarin is accused of firing several shots with an assault rifle at the civilian's head.

104.title: Nath praises BJP workers, says 'no one goes to tell them to work'
104.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath on Friday praised BJP workers, saying, "In the BJP, no one goes to tell the people on the ground that they have to go here or there and do so-and-so work." However, he added that Congress workers "wait for someone to tell them what to do". He further said that this was Congress' "only drawback".

105.title: Delhi govt gets 2 remote-controlled robots to help douse fires
105.article_body: The Delhi government has procured two remote-controlled fire fighting robots. While the robots are under trial, if they seem successful, more such machines will be introduced to the firefighting fleet, said Delhi Home Minister Satyendar Jain. The robots can release water at a high pressure of 2,400 litres/minute which will help in dousing fires faster.

106.title: Gang hacks man to death in broad daylight in TN; act caught on CCTV
106.article_body: Two people have surrendered in a court after a gang of four hacked a 36-year-old man to death in broad daylight on a road in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. The incident, captured on CCTV footage, shows the gang attacking the deceased as he falls on the road. An official said that the deceased had a few pending cases filed against him.

107.title: Oracle co-founder joined call about contesting Trump's defeat: Report
107.article_body: Oracle's billionaire Co-founder Larry Ellison participated in a November 2020 call in which US President Donald Trump's allies brainstormed ways to contest the results of the presidential election, media reports said citing an email. The phone call included Senator Lindsey Graham and longtime Trump legal adviser Jay Sekulow. Ellison had openly supported Trump during the 2020 campaign.

108.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad police arrest 88 history-sheeters in combing op
108.article_body: As many as 88 history-sheeters who were found violating rules were arrested by the Pimpri-Chinchwad police during a massive combing operation. According to the police, 130 criminals were checked during the drive against anti-social elements and offenders on record, in which all of the force's squads were activated. Flying squads were also deployed during the night, the police said.

109.title: Video of 'coal theft' in a Chhattisgarh's coal mine goes viral, probe ordered
109.article_body: The Chhattisgarh Police ordered a probe into a viral video that showed a large number of people digging and carrying away coal illegally from SECL's opencast coal mine in Chhattisgarh's Korba district. After the video went viral, Korba Collector Ranu Sahu visited the mines and claimed that no attempt was made by SECL to stop any such theft.

110.title: Releasing Warner SRH's biggest mistake, should've never let him go: Sehwag
110.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said releasing opener David Warner has been SRH's "biggest" mistake, adding that they should have never let him go irrespective of what happened. "SRH...should have backed Warner, which they did not do," stated Sehwag. "Anyone can have a poor season. Virat Kohli only recently scored that fifty otherwise his season has been really bad," said Sehwag.

111.title: 18-yr-old girl dies by suicide over being scolded for using phone in Thane
111.article_body: An 18-year-old girl died by suicide in Thane's Dombivli after her elder brother scolded her for spending too much time on her mobile phone. According to police, the deceased's brother had removed the SIM card from her phone before going to work on Thursday. On returning home, he found his sister hanging by a rod on the ceiling, police said.

112.title: Keep a close watch on monkeypox situation: Health Minister to officials
112.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has directed the officials at National Centre for Disease Control and ICMR to keep a close watch on the monkeypox situation. The airport and port health officers are asked to be vigilant. They have been reportedly instructed to isolate any sick passenger with a travel history to monkeypox-affected countries and send samples for investigation.

113.title: Zelenskyy proposes deal to secure Russian compensation for invasion
113.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy proposed a formal deal with the country's allies to obtain Russian compensation for the damage caused by its forces during war. Under the deal, Russian funds and property in signatory nations will be seized and directed to a special compensation fund, he added. "Russia will feel...weight of every missile...bomb...which it has fired at us," he said.

114.title: Ashwin's confidence in his ability found in very few players: Shastri
114.article_body: Reacting to RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's 40* off 23 balls against CSK, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "His shot selection under pressure was outstanding. Ashwin targeted the right bowlers and pulled out the big strokes when needed." "The kind of confidence he has in his ability, you find that in very few cricketers," added Shastri.

115.title: Pit viper's venom neutralised with compound from fruits, vegetables
115.article_body: The venom of a pit viper can be neutralised using a substance found in fruits and vegetables, scientists said. They found that a modified version of the compound rutin, the water-soluble succinyl rutin, can delay the effect of a bite. The Bothrops jararaca is reportedly responsible for Brazil's roughly 26,000 recorded snake bites each year.

116.title: 'Tourists who want an exciting time can come', jokes Sri Lanka PM; video viral
116.article_body: During an interview, when asked if it is safe for tourists to visit Sri Lanka, PM Ranil Wickremesinghe joked that tourists who "want to have an exciting" time can come. He added, "Maybe they could take part in the demonstration" or hold placards against the President. Meanwhile, the journalist remarked that his question on tourism was a serious one.

117.title: Senior Shiromani Akali Dal leader Tota Singh passes away aged 81
117.article_body: Senior Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader and a three-time Punjab MLA Tota Singh passed away aged 81 at a private hospital in Mohali on Saturday after a prolonged illness. "He was a father figure to me...His invaluable advice...will always be missed," SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal tweeted. Tota Singh had served as the agriculture and education minister in Punjab.

118.title: BJP has spread kerosene all over the country: Rahul Gandhi
118.article_body: Addressing 'Ideas for India' conclave in London, Rahul Gandhi criticised BJP and said that the ruling party has spread kerosene all over the country, adding that only one spark could lead to a "big trouble". "India is not in a good place...I think it's also the responsibility of Opposition to bring people, communities, states and religions together," Gandhi said.

119.title: CSK win only because of MS Dhoni's captaincy, he brings luck: Sehwag
119.article_body: Virender Sehwag said CSK win "only" because of MS Dhoni's captaincy and the manner in which he utilises his resources. "I don't think anyone can lead the side like [him]," he added. "Dhoni brings [luck] with him," stated Sehwag. "Just imagine how CSK would fare if Dhoni's not there. He'll only leave once he finds a suitable...[leader]," he said.

120.title: 7 get life imprisonment for raping Bangladeshi woman in Bengaluru
120.article_body: All the 12 accused in the Bangladeshi woman gang rape incident in Bengaluru in May 2021 got convicted by a Bengaluru court on Friday. Out of the 12 accused, seven got life imprisonment, one got 20-years in jail, and two more got 9 months in jail. The accused were human traffickers and 11 of them were illegal migrants from Bangladesh.

121.title: Trump pays over ₹85 lakh fine after being held in contempt of court
121.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has paid a $110,000 (over ₹85 lakh) fine after being held in contempt of court. The New York Attorney General's office moved to hold Trump in contempt for not handing over business-related documents for a probe. The office is investigating whether the Trump Organization falsely reported property values to secure loans and obtain tax benefits.

122.title: Naxal-affected Bastar is changing as roads & schools are built: CM Baghel
122.article_body: With the development of roads, bridges and schools, the situation in Naxal-affected Bastar is changing, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said. "Bastar is changing and development work is underway," he said. "Schools reopened after about 15 years...People are getting benefits from state government schemes," he added. "Bastar is developing in health, income and education," Baghel said.

123.title: Man asks Nagpur bakery on Swiggy if cake contains egg, his cake pic goes viral
123.article_body: A man in Maharashtra's Nagpur placed an order for a cake through Swiggy and in the details he remarked, "Please mention if the cake contains egg." Following this, he received a cake with the message "contain egg" written on it. He tweeted, "I am speechless after receiving the order." A Twitter user commented, "This is such a funny mistake."

124.title: Topless woman crashes Cannes to protest against sexual violence in Ukraine
124.article_body: A topless woman crashed the Cannes Film Festival 2022 red carpet to protest against sexual violence in Ukraine. The woman appeared to be wearing body paint in the colours of the flag of Ukraine. She was heard screaming 'Stop raping us' as she was escorted off the red carpet by the security personnel.

125.title: Salman must be bhai for others, for me he is my jaan: World champion boxer Nikhat Zareen
125.article_body: Nikhat Zareen, who recently won gold medal in Women's World Boxing Championships, in an interview, said that Salman Khan must be 'bhai' for others, but for her he is her 'jaan' (life). She added that it is her dream to meet Salman. The actor later took to Twitter to congratulate Nikhat on winning the gold medal.

126.title: 6 die, 3 injured as SUV collides with tractor-trolley in UP's Balrampur
126.article_body: At least six persons were killed and three others were injured after an SUV and a tractor-trolley collided head-on on the Tulsipur-Barhni National Highway in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur on Friday, police said. A 13-year-old boy died in a hospital, police added. The accident took place when the victims were travelling from Laxmanpur to Bhagwanpur, police further said.

127.title: HP Assembly's Dy Speaker purportedly slaps student at school; video surfaces
127.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Assembly Deputy Speaker Hans Raj purportedly slapped a school student in Chamba district, with a video of the incident surfacing on social media. "Why are you laughing?" Hans Raj can be heard saying in the video. Criticising Hans Raj, Congress MLA Vikramaditya Singh termed the incident "unfortunate and unacceptable".

128.title: Unfair on Jadeja but inevitable: Ajay Jadeja on CSK captaincy change
128.article_body: Talking about all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to wicketkeeper-batter MS Dhoni earlier during IPL 2022, former India batter Ajay Jadeja said it was unfair on Jadeja but inevitable considering Dhoni's presence. "There hasn't been a leader like Dhoni," added Ajay. CSK registered six defeats in their opening eight games of IPL 2022 under Jadeja's captaincy.

129.title: Dominica withdraws case against Mehul Choksi over 'illegal entry'
129.article_body: Authorities in Dominica have discontinued the proceedings against fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi over his 'illegal entry' into the island nation, officials said on Saturday. Choksi, who is wanted in connection to the ₹13,500 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case, had claimed he was abducted from Antigua and Barbuda and taken to Dominica against his will.

130.title: Tough to pick his bowling, he'll contribute in a big way: Dhoni on Pathirana
130.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni termed his team's Sri Lankan bowler Matheesha Pathirana as their Lasith Malinga, with both Pathirana and Malinga having a similar action while bowling. "Pathirana is really good. It is difficult to pick him and...he will definitely contribute next year...in a big way," added Dhoni. Pathirana had an economy rate of 7.60 in IPL 2022.

131.title: Don't replace Mahatma Gandhi's statue in Secunderabad: Cong appeals to GHMC
131.article_body: Telangana Congress leader Marri Shashidhar Reddy and other party leaders on Friday appealed to the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) not to replace Mahatma Gandhi's statue at James Street in Secunderabad. "It reminds us of Tughlaq's rule. Installing another statue in the same place is unfortunate, we are against it," Reddy said, adding that the statue has historical significance.

132.title: Rahul remembers father Rajiv on his death anniversary, calls him 'visionary'
132.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi remembered his late father and former PM Rajiv Gandhi on the latter's 31st death anniversary on Saturday. "My father was a visionary leader whose policies helped shape modern India," Rahul tweeted. "He was compassionate...and a wonderful father to me and Priyanka...I dearly miss him and fondly remember the time we spent together," he added.

133.title: Drugs worth ₹17 lakh seized in B'luru in separate incidents; 2 held
133.article_body: The CCB Anti-Narcotics squad has arrested two drug peddlers, including a Tanzanian national, in separate incidents and recovered drugs worth a total of ₹17 lakh from their possession, according to Bengaluru City Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime). One of the accused used to sell the drugs near a college, the police said. The seized drugs include ganja and MDMA.

134.title: Rahul Gandhi is neither scoring runs nor taking wickets: BJP's Raman Singh
134.article_body: BJP's Raman Singh said that Congress wants to make Rahul Gandhi a captain when he himself does not want to be one. "He is not ready to become a non-playing captain either. Rahul Gandhi is neither scoring runs nor taking wickets," Singh added. "After this 'Chintan Shivir', there will be no Congress government left in any state," Singh further said.

135.title: Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka pay homage to Rajiv Gandhi on 31st death anniversary
135.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi along with daughter and party General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra paid homage to former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi on his 31st death anniversary at Vir Bhumi in Delhi. Congress leaders P Chidambaram and Sachin Pilot also paid tributes to Gandhi at his memorial. Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated during an election rally in Tamil Nadu in 1991.

136.title: Ola, Uber get notices by CCPA over alleged unfair trade practices
136.article_body: Ola and Uber have been given notices by the CCPA for alleged unfair trade practices and violation of consumer rights. CCPA said most of the consumer complaints received in the last year are related to "deficiency in services and other unfair trade practices". Over 3,170 consumer complaints were registered against Ola and Uber in the 12 months till 1 May.

137.title: How does monkeypox spread from person to person?
137.article_body: According to WHO, people with monkeypox are infectious while they have symptoms. "You can catch monkeypox through close physical contact with someone who has symptoms. Rash, bodily fluids and scabs are particularly infectious. Clothing, bedding...utensils that have been contaminated from contact with infected person can also infect others. Ulcers...in the mouth can also be infectious," WHO said.

138.title: HC removes WB minister's daughter from job over appointment scam
138.article_body: Calcutta High Court on Friday dismissed West Bengal minister PC Adhikary's daughter Ankita from her job as a teacher at a state government-aided school and ordered her to return the salary she's received since 2018. The court gave the order while hearing a petition over Ankita's alleged appointment as a teacher despite another candidate securing higher marks in recruitment test.

139.title: CCTV footage shows moment when speeding car hits 4 pedestrians in B'luru
139.article_body: A man was killed and three others were injured after a speeding car hit them while they were walking on the side of a road in Bengaluru. The accident, which was caught on CCTV, showed one of the pedestrians flying into the air before colliding with scooters parked nearby. The driver has been arrested in the case.

140.title: Rajnath Singh's flight diverted to Agra due to bad weather in Delhi: Reports
140.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's flight was diverted to Agra due to bad weather in Delhi on Friday, as per reports. Singh was going to Delhi after attending a function at Shri Swaminarayan Mandir in Gujarat's Vadodara. "At least 11 flights including Defence Minister's flight...were diverted to Ahmedabad, Jaipur, Lucknow and Agra due to the unfavourable weather conditions," reports stated.

141.title: Jammu college students protest over mosque's loudspeaker; detained
141.article_body: At least six students from a government college in Jammu were detained on Friday after a group of them recited Hanuman Chalisa in a protest over the use of loudspeaker at a local mosque. The students alleged that their studies were being disturbed at the college. Earlier, the district's civic body had ordered the removal of loudspeakers operating without permission.

142.title: 3 people rob railway officer at knifepoint in Kalyan, arrested
142.article_body: The Kalyan Government Railway Police arrested three people for robbing a railway officer at knifepoint at Kalyan railway station. The incident occurred at around 2 am on Thursday when Chandrakant Karande was returning to his home in Kalyan. "We have recovered the phone and cash. The accused are drug addicts and plan such robberies for easy money," an officer said.

143.title: Suffered damages worth lakhs: Shopkeepers after fire at cycle market in Delhi
143.article_body: After a major fire gutted dozens of shops at the cycle market in Delhi's Jhandewalan on Friday, shopkeepers said they have suffered damages worth lakhs. "We suffered already during COVID...we gave salaries while sitting at home," a shop owner said. "Step by step, we were getting our customers back. But now, we've come back to square one," he added.

144.title: Taliban govt in Afghanistan has zero credibility on women's rights: HRW
144.article_body: Taliban leadership in Afghanistan has "zero credibility" on women's rights, Associate Women's Rights Director at Human Rights Watch Heather Barr said. "They made representations about their supposed respect for women/girls when taking power. Every day after there was a new crackdown on women & that continued to intensify," she added. Recently, Taliban ordered women to cover their faces in public.

145.title: Guru Randhawa’s audio brand DEFY launches new earbuds Gravity Pro
145.article_body: DEFY, certified by Commerzify as India's Most Trusted Brand, unveiled its latest earbuds Gravity Pro, revealing that it features 13mm drivers for immersive sound experience, 4mic ENC for superior call quality, and version 5.3 Bluetooth. The stem-styled wireless earbuds offer 25 hours of playback with 50 ms low latency in blue and black matte finish & white glossy finish variants.

146.title: 3M asked to pay $77 mn to US veteran over earplug hearing damage
146.article_body: A US court has ordered 3M to pay $77.5 million to a US Army veteran who claimed he suffered hearing damage after using the firm's military-issue earplugs. "We were prevented from presenting crucial evidence to the jury, and we will address that issue...in our appeal," 3M said. As of May 16, there were over 2,90,000 claims against the earplugs.

147.title: Took him so long to understand this?: Digvijaya on Jakhar's 'supremacy' remark
147.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh criticised Sunil Jakhar over his "supremacy" remark against Congress and said, "So it took him so long to understand this?" Jakhar, who left Congress and joined BJP on Thursday, had said that supremacy in the Congress party lies with those who flatter high command adding that the Congress party has undergone "a huge change".

148.title: Man, woman die after jumping off flat on 22nd floor in Greater Noida
148.article_body: A man and woman died after they allegedly jumped off a flat on the 22nd floor in a housing society in Greater Noida (West) on Friday, police said. "Both the deceased knew each other. The flat...belonged to the man...the woman had come there...from her home in Ghaziabad," police added. The reason behind their step is yet unknown, police stated.

149.title: Mastermind behind ₹400-crore Citibank scam of 2010 dies of TB in Delhi
149.article_body: The alleged mastermind behind the ₹400-crore Citibank scam of 2010, who was lodged in Bhondsi prison, has died at a hospital in Delhi. Shivraj Puri was suffering from tuberculosis. Puri had allegedly forged documents and transferred ₹400 crore from various customers to fictitious accounts while he worked as a relationship manager with Citibank.

150.title: India reports 2,323 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 14,996
150.article_body: India has reported 2,323 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,259 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 14,996, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,348, according to the latest data.

151.title: Gavaskar says 'Hetmyer's wife has delivered, will he deliver for RR', fans react
151.article_body: While commentating during RR-CSK match, Sunil Gavaskar was heard saying, "Shimron Hetmyer's wife has delivered, will Hetmyer deliver for RR now?" Reacting to his remark, a fan commented, "Why Gavaskar Why?" Another wrote, "Not sure whether we have commentators or trolls on TV." "Are you kidding me?" wrote another.

152.title: Piyush Goyal to lead Indian delegation at World Economic Forum in Davos
152.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will lead India's delegation of ministers and business leaders at the World Economic Forum in Davos from May 23-25. While the event took place virtually last year owing to the COVID-19 pandemic, the WEF was to be held earlier this year but was delayed to May due to the spread of the Omicron variant.

153.title: It is a planning disaster: Supreme Court on illegal construction in Delhi
153.article_body: Commenting on illegal construction in Delhi, Supreme Court said that it is a planning disaster which has occurred for several years. "Single plot houses are now five-storeyed buildings. Continued monitoring is essential as there is a tendency to repeat such acts," it added. SC was hearing an application filed by a Connaught Place property owner who was facing sealing orders.

154.title: Canada bans luxury goods trade with Russia
154.article_body: Canada said it's imposing more sanctions on Russian oligarchs and other associates of President Vladimir Putin and banning the import and export of luxury goods from Russia over Ukraine invasion. The import ban will target Russian goods, including alcoholic beverages, seafood and non-industrial diamonds, while the export ban will target luxury goods such as footwear, luxury clothing and jewellery.

155.title: Rajasthan has become a hub of crime: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore
155.article_body: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore has claimed that Rajasthan has turned into a "hub of crime" under the Congress-run state government's regime. "On one side, Rajasthan tops in crime against women, on the other, it is at the lowest position in the implementation of welfare schemes," the MP from Jaipur Rural said.

156.title: Every Indian's chest will swell with pride: Rajnath on Indo-China face-off information
156.article_body: While talking about the 2020 Indo-China face-off, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said, "Won't say much on it. The way our Army had shown courage and worked charismatically, I will only say that if complete information could be given, every Indian's chest would swell with pride." Twenty Indian soldiers were martyred in the Galwan Valley face-off.

157.title: Samsung leader hosts Biden at plant after being excused from trial
157.article_body: Samsung Electronics Vice Chairman Jay Y Lee hosted US President Joe Biden's tour of a Samsung plant in South Korea, after being excused from attending an accounting fraud trial hearing on Friday. He was seen accompanying Biden and South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol. Biden toured the site of a third production line of the firm's chip production complex.

158.title: Fraudsters offer Mumbai engineer job in UK, cheats him of ₹9 lakh
158.article_body: A 52-year-old Mumbai-based civil engineer was cheated of ₹9 lakh by fraudsters who offered him a job in UK and even conducted fake interview before making him transfer the amount on pretext of making his documents. The complainant's friend had sent him an email related to a job opening and after applying for the same he got the fraud call.

159.title: 2 arrested with 140 kg poppy husk, 50,000 banned pills in Ferozepur
159.article_body: Police arrested two men and reportedly seized 140 kg of poppy husk, 50,000 banned pills and two smartphones from a truck in Ferozepur on Friday. The accused, identified as Kulwant Singh and Gurkirtan Singh, told police they had smuggled in the contraband from Rajasthan. Their other accomplice, Nirvair Singh, is at large.

160.title: Man made B'luru airport hoax bomb call to trap brother-in-law: Police
160.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested a man who allegedly made a hoax bomb threat call at Kempegowda International Airport on Friday. The police said that the accused "wanted to trap his brother-in-law who is going through a divorce with his sister." During the call, the accused had reportedly said that the bomb at the airport would explode in 30 minutes.

161.title: Increased tourists footfall in Kashmir can’t be called normalcy: Omar Abdullah
161.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said the central government has failed to restore normalcy in Kashmir. "Flights and tourists are not [signs of] normalcy. Normalcy is when there's no fear and terror," he said. "No one is feeling secure amid targeted killings. The...fear is such that Pandit employees are ready to quit...jobs and run away," he added.

162.title: Mariupol steel plant 'completely liberated', claims Russia
162.article_body: Russia has claimed its soldiers have "completely liberated" the Azovstal steel plant in the southern Ukrainian city of Mariupol after the last 531 Ukrainian troops inside surrendered. Since May 16, 2,439 Ukrainian soldiers have laid down their arms, Russia's Defence Ministry said. Russia's Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu has informed President Vladimir Putin of "the end of the operation", it added.

163.title: Local train services between Goregaon and Santacruz to be hit for 4 hrs
163.article_body: Mumbai's local train services will remain hit for four hours between Goregaon and Santacruz stations on intermediary night of Saturday (May 21) and Sunday (May 22) to carry out maintenance work. On Up fast line, the block will be from midnight 12 to 4 am, and on Down fast line, the block will be from 12.30 am to 4.30 am.

164.title: Pune jeweller attacked inside his shop, probe underway
164.article_body: A Pune-based jeweller was attacked inside his shop with a sharp object in the city's Ambegaon Budruk area. The accused had come into the shop disguised as a customer before attacking the victim, identified as Vinod Kumar Soni (42), on his head and hands which got the latter injured, police said. However, nothing was stolen from the shop.

165.title: Man stabbed to death over inter-caste marriage in Hyderabad
165.article_body: A man was stabbed to death allegedly by five people in Hyderabad's Begum Bazar on Friday night. The deceased, identified as Neeraj, had married a woman of another caste against her family's consent and police suspect role of his wife's family in the murder. According to police, Neeraj was travelling on a two-wheeler with his father when he was attacked.

166.title: Hindu College professor held for post on 'Shivling' at Gyanvapi mosque
166.article_body: A 50-year-old Associate Professor from Delhi University's Hindu College, Ratan Lal, was arrested for an objectionable online post in connection with the claims of a Shivling found at Varanasi's Gyanvapi mosque, police said. He had allegedly posted a photo of the structure and made objectionable comments, police added. Lal said he had asked police for security after receiving threats online.

167.title: Boeing's Starliner docks with space station for the first time
167.article_body: Boeing's new Starliner crew capsule docked with the International Space Station for the first time on Friday in an uncrewed flight test. Starliner lifted off on Thursday from the US despite the failure of two onboard thrusters. Boeing had said that the failed thrusters posed no risk to the rest of the spaceflight.

168.title: Tesla building hardcore litigation dept: Musk after sexual harassment claims
168.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted that Tesla is building a "hardcore litigation department", a day after a report accused him of sexually harassing a flight attendant in 2016. He added that while the team will directly report to him, listing his commitments he wrote, "We'll never seek victory in a just case against us, even if we will probably win."

169.title: Man forces wife to have physical relationship with friends in Pune
169.article_body: A case has been filed against a man for allegedly forcing his 48-year-old wife to have a physical relationship with two of his friends. The accused watched his friends committing the act, which took place in December 2020 and July 2021, according to the police. The wife had filed the complaint after she reportedly got fed up with constant harassment.

170.title: Russia to cut natural gas supplies to Finland, days after it applied to join NATO
170.article_body: Russia will stop supplying natural gas to Finland after the country which applied for NATO membership recently, refused to pay for its supplies in roubles. Finnish state-owned energy firm Gasum confirmed the news. Natural gas accounts for about eight per cent of Finland's energy consumption, most of which comes from Russia.

171.title: Google to temporarily let Match offer alternate payment systems
171.article_body: Tinder-owner Match Group has said Google will temporarily allow it to offer users a choice in payment systems. Earlier this month, Match had sued Google as a "last resort" to prevent Tinder and its other apps from being removed from the Play Store for refusing to share up to 30% of sales. The trial date is set for April 2023.

172.title: Ashwin thumps his chest 7 times to celebrate four against CSK, video goes viral
172.article_body: RR bowling all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin thumped his chest seven times to celebrate a four in the last over while chasing a 151-run target against CSK. A video of his celebration has gone viral on social media. While talking about the celebration, Ashwin said, "I just brought out the David Warner inside me."

173.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as 3 playoffs get booked?
173.article_body: With their five-wicket victory over CSK, RR finished on the second position on the IPL 2022 points table. They became the third team after GT and LSG to qualify for the playoffs. GT finished the league stage of the tournament on the first position. RR and LSG have 18 points each, with RR having a superior net run-rate (NRR).

174.title: Kanika Kapoor marries NRI businessman Gautam Hathiramani in London; pics surface
174.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor got married to NRI businessman Gautam Hathiramani on Friday. The couple tied the knot in an intimate ceremony attended by family and close friends at a hotel in London. Pictures and videos from the ceremony were shared by their friends on their social media accounts.

175.title: Whose party is more fun: Ravi Shastri on pick between Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli
