"This is an attempt to muzzle a strong voice. CBI's...actions are completely biased," Mehta said. Opposing the raids, Lalu's brother Prabhunath Yadav said, "It's unfortunate that a person who is ill is being deliberately troubled."

349.title: Zilingo fires CEO Ankiti Bose after suspension over financial irregularities
349.article_body: Singapore-based fashion startup Zilingo has fired CEO Ankiti Bose after previously suspending her over alleged financial irregularities. In a statement, the company said that Bose was ousted "with cause" after an investigation led by an independent forensics firm. Meanwhile, Bose in a separate statement said her employment was terminated on grounds of "insubordination".

350.title: We are going to die, that will happen 100%: SL man as PM warns of food shortages
350.article_body: After Sri Lanka's PM Ranil Wickremesinghe warned of food shortages amid the economic crisis, a man working as a part-time chauffeur said, "Without food we are going to die. That will happen hundred percent." "There is no point in talking about how hard life is. I can't predict how things will be in two months," a woman selling fruits said.

351.title: 20-yr-old man gets life sentence for killing employer in Hyderabad
351.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad sentenced a 20-year-old man to life imprisonment for killing his employer. The accused, identified as Vikram, reportedly bore a grudge against his employer for not paying him a good salary. In October 2020, Vikram barged into his employer's home and attacked him with an iron rod. Vikram had also attacked the victim's wife and daughter.

352.title: Authorities demolish 48 houses in MP town after clash during wedding procession
352.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh administration demolished 48 houses on Thursday, two days after stones were hurled at a Dalit man's wedding procession. The attack took place allegedly after members of the Muslim community objected to DJ music being played in front of the mosque. Notices were issued to people after their homes were identified as an encroachment on government land.

353.title: 86% of Dia Free Juice users reduced high blood sugar in 2 months: Kapiva
353.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda claims 86% of Dia Free Juice users observed a drop in high blood sugar while 74% reduced their dependency on daily diabetes medication. The juice is a potent combination of Karela, Giloy, Belpatra, and Vijayasar, which improves insulin utilization, controls sugar level fluctuation, regulates metabolism, boosts energy levels, and supports weight management, Kapiva added.

354.title: Kanika Kapoor to marry NRI businessman, shares pics from mehendi ceremony
354.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor took to Instagram to share pictures from her mehendi ceremony. Kanika is getting married to NRI businessman Gautam. Sharing the photos, she wrote, "G I Love you sooooo much!" This is her second marriage after she reportedly divorced businessman Raj Chandok in 2012, with whom she has three children.

355.title: Rahul asks Cong workers to help those affected by Assam floods
355.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has urged all his party workers and leaders in Assam to provide assistance in relief operations in the recent floods and landslides that have taken place in the state. "Lakhs of people are affected by severe flooding," Gandhi tweeted. Notably, over 7 lakh people have been affected by the calamity, Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

356.title: Shanghai detects new infections after 5 days of zero COVID-19 cases
356.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai on Thursday reported new COVID-19 cases outside quarantined areas for the first time after five days of no infections. All three people who tested positive in Xujing Town in Qingpu district were triple-vaccinated and were from the same family, authorities said. The town's over 2,00,000 people have been re-tested and all results were negative, they added.

357.title: Wild accusations untrue, it never happened: Musk on sexual harassment claims
357.article_body: Reacting to the sexual harassment allegations against him, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted that the "wild accusations are utterly untrue." He added, "I've a challenge to this liar who claims their friend saw me "exposed"...describe just one thing, anything at all (scars, tattoos) that isn't known by the public. She won't be able to do so, because it never happened."

358.title: Our challan will meet him soon: Mumbai Police on picture of man taking selfie on road
358.article_body: Reacting to a complaint shared by a Twitter page called 'mumbaimatterz' in which a man can be seen taking selfie on his scooty in the middle of a road, Mumbai Police said, "Our challan will meet him soon." Retweeting the picture of the man, the police wrote, "Ab inhone bulaya hai toh jaana hi hoga...mauka bhi hai...kanoon bhi!"

359.title: SpiceJet flights stopped over non-payment of dues at Delhi airport
359.article_body: The Delhi ATC had stopped several SpiceJet flights on Friday as the airline did not make the requisite daily payment to the AAI. The ATC was instructed not to give clearance to the flights to take off as the payment was not made. SpiceJet said the payment failed due to a glitch in the software through which it makes payment.

360.title: What is Twitter's new 'crisis misinformation' policy?
360.article_body: Designed to tackle "situations of armed conflict, public health emergencies, and large-scale natural disasters," the policy ​will help hide tweets that share false information during such situations. While Twitter said it would rely on various credible sources to check if a tweet is misleading, it will also prioritise adding warning notices to viral tweets and tweets from high-profile accounts.

361.title: B'luru Customs intercept parcel with ₹20 lakh-cannabis; 1 arrested
361.article_body: Bengaluru Customs tweeted on Thursday that its officers intercepted a parcel that originated from the US at the Foreign Post Office and detected cannabis worth approximately ₹20 lakh. It said that one person, who was caught during the controlled delivery operation, has been arrested and remanded to judicial custody. The seized cannabis weighs 950 gm, it added.

362.title: Sri Lanka closes schools, limits work amid fuel shortage
362.article_body: Sri Lanka on Friday closed schools and asked non-essential public officials not to come to work amid fuel shortage. Authorities have also announced nationwide power cuts of up to four hours a day because they cannot supply enough fuel to power generating stations. Sri Lanka is now almost without gasoline and faces an acute shortage of other fuels.

363.title: Hardik Patel quit Congress fearing jail in sedition cases: Jagdish Thakor
363.article_body: After Hardik Patel resigned from Congress on Wednesday, the party's Gujarat chief Jagdish Thakor claimed, "Hardik feared that he may have to go to jail in sedition cases if he stays in the Congress." "Hence, to save himself from the possible punishment, he decided to quit the Congress and he might join the BJP as well," he added.

364.title: Pune Police transfers Ruby Hall Clinic case to crime branch
364.article_body: The Pune Police have transferred the alleged kidney transplant malpractice case at the city's Ruby Hall Clinic to the crime branch unit on Thursday. "They (crime branch) have taken the case papers today (Thursday)," said Additional Commissioner of Police (Crime) Ramnath Pokale. Notably, the FIR names 15 persons, with the police having arrested two middlemen so far.

365.title: Air India plane makes emergency landing in Mumbai after engine shuts down midair
365.article_body: An Air India flight, headed to Bengaluru, made an emergency landing in Mumbai soon after take-off on Thursday morning after one of its engines shut down midair. "The aircraft came back due to a technical glitch. Our...teams have started looking into it. Meanwhile, another aircraft was arranged for passengers to fly to Bengaluru," Air India spokesperson said.

366.title: Man stabs woman to death at Goa beach for ending relationship, held
366.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stabbing a 19-year-old woman to death at Goa's Velsao beach after she refused to continue relationship with him, police said. The accused was arrested a day after the woman's body was found in the bushes by the beach. "The accused was in love with woman, who was studying in a college," police added.

367.title: While other kids went to play, Rimmi & I worked: Celina recalls modelling days
367.article_body: Actress Celina Jaitly took to Instagram to share throwback pictures from her modelling days with her school friend, actress Rimmi Sen. Celina, who started modelling at the age of 16, wrote, "While other kids went to play after school and on weekends, Rimmi and I went to work." "I think sometimes we even studied on our shoots," she further wrote.

368.title: Twitter to label false tweets on Ukraine, disable likes, retweets
368.article_body: Twitter has announced that it will start putting misleading and false posts regarding the conflict in Ukraine behind a warning notice and limit their spread. The platform will not amplify or recommend such tweets and likes, retweets and shares will be disabled. It'll prioritise adding labels to misleading tweets from high-profile accounts such as verified users or official government profiles.

369.title: Pune Customs intercept vehicle near temple, seize 51 kg marijuana
369.article_body: Pune Customs said on Thursday that its Narcotics Cell intercepted a vehicle near the Khandoba Temple in Jejuri and seized 51 kg of marijuana from it. Two people have been arrested in the matter. On searching the vehicle, three gunny bags were found concealed below the passenger seat and the marijuana was recovered, Pune Customs Deputy Commissioner Himani Dhamija said.

370.title: SP leader Azam Khan released from Sitapur jail after 27 months
370.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan was released from UP's Sitapur district jail on Friday, a day after Supreme Court granted him interim bail in an alleged case of cheating. SC also gave Khan two weeks to apply for regular bail before the concerned court. Khan had been in jail for the last 27 months in connection with several cases.

371.title: Sidhu seeks few weeks' time from SC to surrender in 1988 road rage case
371.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu has sought a few weeks' time from Supreme Court to surrender in the 1988 road rage case citing some "medical conditions". SC asked Sidhu's lawyer to move a proper application and mention it before the CJI bench. This comes a day after Sidhu was sentenced to one year in jail in connection with the case.

372.title: Vijay meets T'gana CM K Chandrashekar Rao amid Thalapathy 66 shoot in Hyd
372.article_body: Actor Vijay, who is currently shooting for his upcoming project with filmmaker Vamshi Paidipally, met Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday. Vijay met the CM along with Vamshi at Pragathi Bhavan in Hyderabad. The project, tentatively titled 'Thalapathy 66', also stars Rashmika Mandanna and Sarath Kumar, among others.

373.title: He is drunk in appeasement politics: Maurya on Akhilesh's remark on temples
373.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark on temples, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said that he is drunk in "appeasement politics". "Akhilesh Yadav ji has forgotten the essence of 'sanatan' Hinduism," Maurya added. Earlier, Akhilesh said, "Just by placing a rock, a red flag under a pipal tree it becomes a temple in the Hindu religion."

374.title: Akasa Air's launch may be postponed over delay in aircraft delivery
374.article_body: The launch of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air is likely to be delayed further as the airline expects to receive its first aircraft in June or July, as per a DGCA official. Akasa Air had initially planned to start its operations in June. Akasa Air has said it intends to start commercial operations in July.

375.title: Google deceptively collects data in Incognito mode: US lawsuit
375.article_body: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed an amended privacy lawsuit against Google accusing it of collecting data of users who think they can be anonymous if they use the Incognito mode. "In reality, Google deceptively collects an array of personal data even when a user has engaged Incognito mode," the suit alleges. "We...will vigorously defend ourselves," Google has said.

376.title: Told Rahul to expel Sidhu, Jakhar but he didn't listen: Sukhjinder Randhawa
376.article_body: Congress leader and former Deputy CM of Punjab Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa on Thursday claimed that he had told the Congress leadership, including Rahul Gandhi, in February to expel both Navjot Singh Sidhu and Sunil Jakhar from the party. However, Rahul Gandhi did not listen to him, Randhawa said. "What Congress couldn't do, Supreme Court has done today," Randhawa added.

377.title: 1955 Mercedes-Benz car sold for record-breaking ₹1,100 crore in Germany
377.article_body: A 1955 Mercedes-Benz 300 SLR Uhlenhaut Coupé sold for €135 million (over ₹1,100 crore) in a secret auction in Germany on May 5, Mercedes-Benz Chairman Ola Källenius has confirmed. The sale broke the previous public record of $48.4 million paid in 2018 for a 1962 Ferrari 250 GTO at an RM Sotheby’s auction.

378.title: You can't abuse Adani or Ambani every time: Hardik Patel to Congress
378.article_body: Patidar leader Hardik Patel on Thursday criticised the Congress for purportedly "taking out anger" over PM Narendra Modi being from Gujarat on businessmen like Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani. "A businessman rises due to his or her own hard work. [Congress] can't abuse Adani or Ambani every time," he added. This comes after Patel resigned from the Congress on Wednesday.

379.title: Pune-Delhi SpiceJet flight delayed by 7 hrs due to operational reasons
379.article_body: A Pune-Delhi SpiceJet flight got delayed by 7 hours in its take-off from the Pune airport in Lohegaon on Wednesday due to "operational reasons". The flight was supposed to take-off at 5.35 pm but got as late as 12:30 am. "SpiceJet flight SG 8184 was delayed...Passengers were informed about the revised departure time at 2 pm," a SpiceJet spokesperson said.

380.title: Russia using food as a weapon in Ukraine: US
380.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said Russia is "using food as a weapon" in Ukraine. "The food supply for millions of Ukrainians and millions more around the world has quite literally been held hostage by the Russian military," he added. Reacting to Blinken's allegations, a senior Russian official said Russians "weren't idiots" and wouldn't export food amid tough sanctions.

381.title: BJP has encroached on government land in Delhi: AAP
381.article_body: AAP on Thursday released a list of BJP leaders accusing them of encroaching on government land in Delhi and asked when the party would run bulldozers over their illegal construction. "We've photographic evidence of residences of BJP leaders...which clearly shows encroachment, illegal occupation of government land and unauthorised constructions," said Saurabh Bharadwaj, Chief Spokesperson, AAP.

382.title: Domestic help beaten up by couple, found in pool of urine in Delhi
382.article_body: A 48-year-old woman, who worked as domestic help, was allegedly beaten up by her employers in Delhi's Rajouri Garden, police said. "The couple dropped her at my office...Later, I found her lying in her own urine and saw that she couldn't move," her placement agency's owner said. The victim's employers also allegedly chopped off her hair, police added.

383.title: Attacks on me should be seen via political lens: Musk after sexual misconduct claims
383.article_body: Tesla CEO on Friday tweeted, "Attacks against me should be viewed through a political lens...this is their standard (despicable) playbook...But nothing will deter me from fighting for a good future and your right to free speech." Musk's tweet comes after a report claimed that he allegedly sexually harassed a flight attendant, who worked for SpaceX's corporate jet in 2016.

384.title: TN Cong protest over Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release
384.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee on Thursday held silent protests in parts of the state over the release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in late PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case. Party workers covered their mouths with a white cloth during the protests. Congress should "withdraw its support to DMK government" over the issue, state BJP chief K Annamalai said.

385.title: 2 policemen electrocuted on paddy field in Kerala
385.article_body: Two policemen died of electrocution on a paddy field near their camp in Kerala's Palakkad on Thursday. According to police, the victims, Ashokan and Mohandas, came in contact with a live wire trap laid to catch wild boars that enter the field to eat up the crops. Two locals have been arrested for their alleged involvement in laying the trap.

386.title: Health is the real wealth, don’t miss out on health investment: Diataal
386.article_body: Diataal has been relaunched in the market with Bollywood's mother-son duo Neetu Kapoor & Ranbir Kapoor. They've come together to endorse a brand for the first time. The brand said, Diataal takes care of 16 vital vitamins & minerals to ensure overall well-being and taking 1 Diataal daily after meals is your first step towards good health and well-being.

387.title: Pak bans imports of all non-essential luxury items to stabilise economy
387.article_body: Pakistan has banned the import of all non-essential luxury items in order to stabilise its economy, said the information minister on Thursday. The items included in the ban are cars, mobile phones, home appliances and cosmetics. Amid declining foreign exchange reserves, the minister said, "There is an emergency situation in the country."

388.title: Kangana Ranaut buys Mercedes Maybach S680 worth over ₹3 crore
388.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has bought a Mercedes Maybach S680 worth over ₹3 crore. She unveiled her new car in front of the paparazzi on Thursday, ahead of the screening of her upcoming movie 'Dhaakad' in Mumbai. Kangana attended the premiere of 'Dhaakad' with her parents, sister Rangoli Chandel, brother Aksht Ranaut and sister-in-law Ritu Sangwan.

389.title: Samsung leader excused from trial hearing ahead of Biden's plant visit
389.article_body: Samsung leader Jay Y Lee has been excused from attending an accounting fraud trial hearing on Friday, ahead of US President Joe Biden's tour of a Samsung plant in South Korea. Lee is expected to accompany Biden during his tour of the plant in Pyeongtaek. The plant is expected to be Biden's first stop on his trip to South Korea.

390.title: Drive against illegal parking launched by traffic police in Noida
390.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Traffic Police launched a drive against illegal parking in the district. The officials removed illegally parked vehicles from several areas including Model Town crossing, Surajpur and Pari Chowk. "In some areas...vehicles are parked along roads, leading to traffic jams...We request residents to visit our Twitter page to complain about congested stretches," an official said.

391.title: Virat Kohli consoles angry Matthew Wade after controversial dismissal, pics go viral
391.article_body: RCB's Virat Kohli was seen consoling GT's Matthew Wade, who was angry at being adjudged LBW out despite his bat seemingly hitting the ball. As Wade was walking back to the pavilion, Kohli went towards Wade and put his arm around Wade's shoulder. Wade was later seen throwing his bat and helmet in anger in the dressing room.

392.title: He is a 'pocket rocket': Ravi Shastri on Rinku Singh's 40 (15) vs LSG
392.article_body: Discussing KKR batter Rinku Singh's 40 off 15 balls against LSG, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Rinku is a "pocket rocket" adding that his knock brought KKR back in the game out of nowhere. "Rinku may be small in frame but hits the ball really hard. [I] really enjoyed his batting," stated Shastri. LSG defeated KKR by two runs.

393.title: 'It's hell there': Ukraine Prez says Russia has fully destroyed Donbas
393.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russian forces have "completely destroyed" the Donbas region and accused Moscow of carrying out "senseless" bombardments as it intensified its offensive. "It's hell there and that's not an exaggeration," he added. Zelenskyy also accused Russian forces of attempting to "kill as many Ukrainians as possible", repeating that Russia is committing "genocide".

394.title: Jakhar started working for BJP long before joining it: Punjab Cong chief
394.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja criticised Sunil Jakhar for leaving Congress and joining BJP and said that Jakhar's move was "not unexpected" as he had been working for the party long before joining it. Jakhar was doing "Hindutva politics"  and the reason for doing so is revealed now, Raja added. Jakhar was damaging Congress in every way, Raja said.

395.title: India reports 2,259 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 15,044
395.article_body: India has reported 2,259 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,364 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 15,044, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,323, according to the latest data.

396.title: Congress alleges over ₹9,000 cr scam in proposals cleared by BMC
396.article_body: Congress on Thursday alleged a TDR (Transferable Development Rights) scam of ₹9,380 crore in proposals cleared by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). Former opposition leader Ravi Raja made the allegations in context of the construction of 14,000 tenements for Project Affected Persons in Chandivali, Mulund, Bhandup and Parel. "There're large scale irregularities in the project," Raja said.

397.title: Bengaluru airport receives hoax bomb threat call, security heightened
397.article_body: The authorities at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport received a hoax call claiming the presence of a bomb at the airport on Friday. Security was heightened at the airport following the threat call. "Today early morning, a bomb threat call was received by the control room. It is being verified by the police. Further details will be shared later," police said.

398.title: Something weird is going on in our universe: NASA
398.article_body: Hubble Space Telescope has reached a new milestone in its work to find out how quickly the universe is expanding, NASA said, adding that data suggests "something weird is going on". "There is a discrepancy between the expansion rate as measured in the local universe compared to independent observations from right after the big bang," NASA said.

399.title: She was encouraged to get licensed as masseuse for Musk: Flight attendant's friend
399.article_body: After a flight attendant alleged sexual harassment by Tesla CEO Elon Musk in 2016, her friend said seniors at her workplace encouraged her friend to "get licensed as a masseuse" for sessions with Musk. She said, "They implied that she'd get to fly more often if she were to do this because she'd be able to give Elon proper massages."

400.title: Haven't worked on Dogecoin for 7.5 yrs, & won't ever again: Co-creator
400.article_body: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus took to Twitter to clarify that he doesn't work on Dogecoin anymore, saying, "I haven't for 7.5 years, and I won't ever again." "One goal here is just to help people see the cryptocurrency market for what it actually is. Doing so in an amusing way is a bonus," he added.
